text: Tomorrow could be an all-time epic stage, the final half is all uphill to Mt. Ventoux's summit finish. Forecast 100kph winds above the treeline for the final 6km; organizers may curtail the finish but if not it’ll be one of the greatest climbs in all the tour. Today’s finish saw the race leader drawn into a final sprint after a really windy flat so he’s likely more tired than usual and everyone will be positioning their climbing riders to attack. I’m going to try to get in around 7:30 and watch here at the office.

the team ORICA BikeExchange does a really good behind-the-scenes series called Backstage Pass, they’re super small and scrappy and have no money so it’s kinda like ‘holy smokes we’re in the Tour, check this out’, it’s good fun. Yesterday they won their first stage in like three years, and the BTS is not only a little insight into how tactics work well, having riders lead out for the other riders, provoke reactions from other teams, etc., but also a good bit of underdog emotion: <https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=YH0FL-KRL8Q>
